content:
That's a great observation! Being more productive during certain times of the day is a common benefit of regular meditation practice. It's as if your mind has become more attuned to your natural rhythms and energy levels.

The 2-4 pm window is an interesting one. Research suggests that the human brain has a natural dip in alertness around 2-3 pm, but it seems like you've found a way to harness that time for focused work.

It's possible that your meditation practice has helped you develop greater self-awareness, allowing you to recognize your most productive times and optimize your schedule accordingly. By doing so, you're able to tackle complex tasks with greater ease and efficiency.

Do you find that you're also better at prioritizing tasks and managing your time during this productive window? Are there any specific strategies you use to minimize distractions and stay focused during this time?

(By the way, I'm curious - have you noticed any changes in your creativity or problem-solving skills since starting your meditation practice?)
